div.p: Sack lunches will continue to be available for Canton School District students, at no cost. The pick-up time will be changed starting Monday, April 6th – lunches will be available from 11:00 am to 12:30 pm. A parent may pick up a lunch for the student. Bus route students are reminded to call the school to arrange a drop off. Contact the school with any questions, 764-2706 ext. 182. Pick up sites will be: High School Lunchroom entrance door - Elementary entrance door - Old CCJ Elem. Bus drop off point

Canton MS-HS Online Learning Plan - Click Here
Governor Noem has announced that schools are to remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. The expectation is that schools will continue to provide instruction to students and will follow their original calendar for the 2019-20 school year, with the final end date determined by the local school board. As mentioned previously, this item will be discussed at the April Board meeting next Monday. Because of the restrictions placed on public assembly, the School Board Meeting on Monday, April 13th will be live-streamed. A link for that meeting will be placed on our school website. In addition, the SD High School Activities Association has cancelled all spring events. Although the Canton School District will be unable to host Prom during the school year, I have spoken with a representative from After-Prom and they are hoping to put something together over the summer where they could disperse their prizes. The Spring Musical has been postponed until further notice as well. To our seniors – we will be working on organizing a modified graduation ceremony. The District will be sending out a survey to those families with a senior seeking their feedback. This is an unprecedented time across our state and country, and we do not make any of these decisions lightly. I want to thank everyone for your patience and understanding throughout this entire process.

br.span: With the recent announcements from the Governor's office, the HS Office and the Lawrence Elementary Office will be CLOSED until May 1, 2020. Please continue to email your students' teachers or any office staff if you have a question. Thank you! Be Safe!

p.strong: Please consider collecting your pop tabs for Ronald McDonald House and dropping them off at the Canton High School (next to main doors).
p.span: The tabs go towards families who need to stay at a Ronald McDonald House to care for their sick children.
